body:
@julien-h I wrote a [colab notebook](https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1ws_i1Lu6Gx6_8WWEMzv0kOPlL7tAEvQJ#scrollTo=0Uv6sxTpTNGV) to investigate this issue.

The error is caused by the `mlflow.log-model.history` tag. On each epoch, `mlflow.keras.log_model` appends logged model info (a dict which looks like below) to this tag. After several epochs, this tag becomes very large and exceeds the length limit.

```
{'artifact_path': 'best_model',
 'flavors': {'keras': {'data': 'data',
                       'keras_module': 'tensorflow.keras',
                       'keras_version': '2.3.0-tf'},
             'python_function': {'data': 'data',
                                 'env': 'conda.yaml',
                                 'loader_module': 'mlflow.keras',
                                 'python_version': '3.6.9'}},
 'run_id': '43d7deafb5b74cf489f2ecbbc9e3828c',
 'utc_time_created': '2020-07-03 06:31:25.337757'}
```

Thanks for reporting this @julien-h and debugging @harupy. 

Related: The proposal in #2931 is to truncate long tags rather than failing, which would band-aid this issue.
@AveshCSingh: I am trying to get started in OSS contributions for mlflow wonder if a can try to tackle this one with some mentorship from the community.
Absolutely, @nlauchande! Are you planning on implementing [this FR](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/2931) to resolve the issue?
@AveshCSingh : Sorry didn't relook at this thead in a while. Yes indeed i am looking at implementing this FR .

> @julien-h I wrote a [colab notebook](https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1ws_i1Lu6Gx6_8WWEMzv0kOPlL7tAEvQJ#scrollTo=0Uv6sxTpTNGV) to investigate this issue.
> 
> The error is caused by the `mlflow.log-model.history` tag. On each epoch, `mlflow.keras.log_model` appends logged model info (a dict which looks like below) to this tag. After several epochs, this tag becomes very large and exceeds the length limit.
> 
> ```
> {'artifact_path': 'best_model',
>  'flavors': {'keras': {'data': 'data',
>                        'keras_module': 'tensorflow.keras',
>                        'keras_version': '2.3.0-tf'},
>              'python_function': {'data': 'data',
>                                  'env': 'conda.yaml',
>                                  'loader_module': 'mlflow.keras',
>                                  'python_version': '3.6.9'}},
>  'run_id': '43d7deafb5b74cf489f2ecbbc9e3828c',
>  'utc_time_created': '2020-07-03 06:31:25.337757'}
> ```

I am using `mlflow.tensorflow.autolog()` and also facing the same issue as well. It is failing at the step where it log the model summary at training start - [doc](https://www.mlflow.org/docs/latest/python_api/mlflow.tensorflow.html#mlflow.tensorflow.autolog)
If we were to build a DL model, the model summary would most certainly exceed the 5000 limit. Is there other ways to log in mlflow?  

```
ERROR mlflow.utils.rest_utils: API request to https://<mlflow-endpoint>/api/2.0/mlflow/runs/set-tag failed with code 500 !=200, retrying up to 0 more times. API response body: {"error_code": "INTERNAL_ERROR", "message": "Tag value\'Model: \\"functional_1\\"\\n__________________________________________________________________________________________________\\nLayer (type)                    Output Shape         Param #     Connected to                     \\n==============================\' had length 6334, which exceeded length limit of 5000"}\n'
```

Hi @harupy
I'm working on https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/2931 and would like to access your colab notebook to investigate and reproduce the issue, so if you don't mind, could you please grant access to the notebook? Thank you.

@harupy 
Sorry to bother you again, I wrote my own notebook to investigate and/or reproduce the issue.
By the way, may I ask which committer is responsible for https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/2931 ?
Or should I ask this question in Slack channel or somewhere? @AveshCSingh seems not active lately.
I need to discuss the implementation strategy to work on. Thank you.
